sen.j: 審祥（しんしょう・しんじょう、生没年不詳）は、奈良時代の華厳宗の僧。
sen.e: Shinsho (Shinjo) was a Buddhist priest of the Kegon Sect in the Nara period.
Shinsho (Shinjo) was a Buddhist priest of the Kegonshu sect in the Nara period.

sen.j: 唐に渡って法蔵から華厳を学んだとされるが、新羅学生と名乗っていることから新羅で華厳教学を学んだとする説もある。
sen.e: It is presumed that Shinsho went to Tang Dynasty of China and learned Kegon (a thought of virtues are correctly provided due to trainings and performing acts of charity) from Hozo, but since he called himself "shiragi gakusei" (student of Silla), another theory has that he learned Kegon in Silla.

sen.j: 天平年間（729年－749年）に帰国して奈良大安寺に住した。
sen.e: He returned to Japan somewhere in the Tenpyo era (729 to 749) and stayed at Daian-ji Temple in Nara.

sen.e: He served as a lecturer of Kegon-kyo (Avatamsaka Sutra) for three years for the lecture on this sutra started by Roben at Konshu-ji Temple in 740.
